climbs.name: A Delicate Dance
climbs.fa: Max Fisher and Greg Hughes December 2018

content.description:
Climb a short bit of rock off the beach to get on the narrow band of ice. Climb this for about 45 meters to where it begins to become lower in angle and belay. In good conditions this could be much a much easier pitch than on the first ascent. Continue up on very good ice to the base of a steep curtain and belay. The final pitch has a short crux and then easy ice to the trees.

This is the first obvious line in the area as you move from east to west. 
A rack of screws for pro and anchors. Tree anchor at the top.

climbs.name: After Eight
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Craig Norris and Shannon Wu

content.description:
This is the longest route in the park and it provides a lot of enjoyable climbing. 
Pitch 1 - Locate a 25 meter flow that starts with some easy climbing and increases in difficulty until you reach the lip of the drainage. Belay from a Spruce tree above the lip. WI3+ 30 meters.  
Continue up a very easy snow, rock and ice gulley to the base of a slightly steeper section. WI1 45 meters. 
Pitch 2 - Climb a long wide pitch of easy ice to the base of the first steep curtain. WI2 60 meters.
Pitch 3 - Ascend the curtain and continue up two more long sections of moderate climbing that lead to a steep headwall with a 25 meter pillar of ice. A good place to belay is in behind the pillar on the right side in a cave. WI 3+ 60 meters
Pitch 4 - Climb the steep pillar to a lower angled ramp leading up and slightly right. The final steep section leads to the top. Climb over a downed tree out right and anchor off a big tree. WI4 60 meters.

Located between A Delicate Dance and Boxing Day Bash. Very easy to spot. Look high on the wall and you will see the final two steep curtains. 
A rack of screws for anchors and pro.

Lots of moderate climbing to a final steep curtain high up on the wall.

Located between After Eight and Chignecto Unchained. 
A rack of screws.

Same start as Chignecto Unchained. Climb up to the the base of the Chignecto Unchained pillar and belay. The crux pitch had a free hanging curtain that was not quite touching down. In fat conditions this pitch would be much easier. Protect the moves off the belay with either a couple of ice screws down low or some rock gear next the curtain.

Same start as Chignecto Unchained. 
A rack of screws and a light rock rack.

climbs.name: Chignecto Unchained
climbs.fa: Max Fisher and Greg Hughes December 2017

content.description:
Easy climbing up to the final pitch where a steep pillar/curtain forms next to an overhanging portion of rock. 

The start is about 100 meters left of Boxing Day Bash. 
A rack of screws. Rock gear would be unnecessary in good conditions.
The next cove as you head west toward Refugee. This area has great potential for mixed climbing. There are already a handful of good climbs but with a few bolts there could be many more.
